sections.title: Skald (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Skald class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds are proficient with all simple and martial weapons, light and medium armor, and shields (except tower shields). They can cast skald spells without arcane spell failure chance while wearing light or medium armor.

sections.title: Bardic [Knowledge](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/skills/knowledge) (Ex) (Skald)
sections.description: A skald adds half his class level (minimum 1) to all Knowledge skill checks and can make all Knowledge checks untrained.

sections.title: Cantrips (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds learn 0-level spells that can be cast without consuming spell slots and may be used repeatedly.

sections.title: Spell Casting (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds cast arcane spells from the bard spell list using Charisma as their casting ability. They are spontaneous casters with verbal components required for all spells.

sections.title: Raging Song (Su) (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds use musical performances to grant allies combat bonuses and abilities. The core ability is Inspired Rage, which grants morale bonuses to Strength, Constitution, and Will saves but imposes skill restrictions.

sections.title: Scribe Scroll (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds automatically receive Scribe Scroll as a bonus feat at 1st level.

sections.title: Versatile Performance (Ex) (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds can substitute their Perform skill bonus for certain associated skills. Advanced options include expanded versatility, martial performance, and masterpieces.

sections.title: Well-Versed (Ex) (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds gain a +4 bonus on saving throws against bardic performance, sonic effects, and language-dependent effects.

sections.title: Rage Powers (Ex) (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds learn barbarian rage powers that they can share with allies during inspired rage. Rage powers cannot require standard actions or rounds of rage to activate.

sections.title: Uncanny Dodge (Ex) (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds cannot be caught flat-footed and retain their Dex bonus to AC against invisible attackers, though they can still be feinted.

sections.title: Spell Kenning (Su) (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds can cast spells from the bard, cleric, or sorcerer/wizard spell lists by expending a same-level spell slot. Casting time is minimum 1 full round.

sections.title: Lore Master (Ex) (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds can take 10 on any Knowledge skill check with ranks and can take 20 as a standard action a limited number of times per day.

sections.title: Improved Uncanny Dodge (Ex) (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds cannot be flanked unless the attacker has at least four more sneak attack class levels than the skald has skald levels.

sections.title: Damage Reduction (Ex) (Skald)
sections.description: Skalds gain damage reduction that also applies to allies affected by their inspired rage, increasing at higher levels.

sections.title: Master Skald (Su) (Skald)
sections.description: At 20th level, inspired rage removes AC penalties and skill restrictions, allows rage-dependent abilities, and grants an extra attack like haste.

sections.title: Great Kenning (Su) (Skald)
sections.description: The skald can use spell kenning three additional times per day and select an additional spell list for spell kenning.
